channel.title: PC games you may have not played
channel.description:
These may be known games, but yet you just heard of it, and never gave it a try..You should, because they're more than what you've read/seen about them
MY recommendation is :
Blade the edge of darkness Call of Cthulhu Dark Corners of the Earth Penumbra World of goo Max payne (Ye ye, but yesterday a friend told me he never played it... :fffuuu: )
That's it for now :stuck_out_tongue: , that's MY recommendation for YOU, do whatever you want with it, those may not be a MUST HAVE, but they surely are a MUST TRY...Afterall the point of this is to "force" you to atleast Try them =P
I didn't name many, then you guys can recommend too =P

item.title: PC games you may have not played
item.dc:creator: Katana
item.description:
From the newest episode:

Sam: I wonder what’s in this wardrobe.
Max: Don’t open it, Sam! It probably leads to a fantastical world filled with wonder and religious allegory!
Sam: Good call, Max. We already wasted enough time poking around that tollbooth.

One game I really enjoyed despite not expecting to was Mount and Blade. It’s a “sim” sort of game where you’re put in a medieval world filled with absolutely NO magic whatsoever (hooray). You create an army of up to several hundred units, or even stay small with 17 or so, and then fight on horseback against bandits, looters, or if you’re daring enough, other nations. There’s a demo available that gives you a pretty good idea of what it’s like.

Read full topic
item.source: PC games you may have not played

item.title: PC games you may have not played
item.dc:creator: Grey_Acumen
item.description:
Baldur’s Gate series = Best D&D RPG ever. Fuck your graphics and 3rd edition ruleset. It is the only game I have ever played in which I choose my party members based more on their personality than on their skillset, and that’s what makes it a REAL “Role Play” Game.

Psychonauts = Best Platformer. It’s got Puzzles, Battles, Huge range of unique levels, solid core gameplay mechanics, quirky characters with deep and detailed personalities, and a great story some really cool twists. In short, it has everything.

Cave Story = Best Indie Game. PC version is Free, Wiiware version is updated from the ground up. Divergent Storylines, awesome gameplay mechanics, strong emotions and an EPIC hidden ending.

Sam&Max = I played Secret of Monkey Island and had fun, but I had more fun on any individual episode of Sam & Max than I did on any individual Part of SoMI, even with the upgraded interface of SoMI: Special Edition. Sam & Max has 11 episodes already and is coming out with another 5 this year.

Read full topic

Games I’ve never played, but would like to:

Anything involving Pokemon - Awesome, don’t hate on pokemon

item.source: PC games you may have not played

item.title: PC games you may have not played
item.dc:creator: JohnKiller118
item.description:
FireTime:

^that

I was never into that genera of game until I have seen it done properly like the first thief.

Ever played Metal Gear 2 for the MSX?
THAT is stealth done properly.

raw_bean:

Thief essentially created that genre.

No. Metal Gear for the MSX and Castle Wolfenstein for the Commodore 64/Apple II did.
And while I’m at it, Metal Gear Solid, the second 3D stealth game, with the first being Tenchu, was released in Japan two months before Theif. Metal Gear Solid, while it didn’t create it, is rightfully credited for setting the standard for the 3D stealth genre… not Thief.

As you can see, I like stealth games… allot.

Read full topic
